instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
threads.message:
Machine arrived no greenlight so I tookout the mlb and when i plugged it in it worked. So I put it back in the machine and sure enough it worked fine.
Except for not detecting a battery, I couldnt see any corrosion on the board despite this being milk damaged. So I decided to ultrasonic it.

Now the machine boots but gets stuck on apple loading screen, but if i press capslock it lights up and if i press other keys it makes that beep noise.

So seems like the machine is booting but display is getting stuck on the apple boot logo?

Resoldered <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> no change in results.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
threads.message: Ugh these symptoms always suck. Only thing to do is look where the corrosion was and find the corroded trace/resistor. Maybe crap under a chip too.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
threads.message: Are there any specific areas/circuits I should go over?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
threads.message:
Video area/MUXes/GPU power. I have a board with similar issues here, been here for over a year. Still not scrapped it as I have hope that one day......
Does it boot EFI ASD version?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
threads.message:
Can I join the party? I have a board here since more than two months, resoldered and replaced <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>, replaced GPU but nothing. It is always stuck on the Apple logo. Replaced and reflashed BIOS, still nothing.

No liquid damage or repair history.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
threads.message: Passes EFI ASD no prob. Same prob with OS ASD though stuck on loading apple

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
threads.message: Nothing I can help with besides saying find the corrosion. These symptoms suck.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
threads.message: I'll try going over the whole board again. So annoying when it's so close to working

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
threads.message: Had one with this issue today. Was only a dead SMC to start, but idiots came before me and fucked with the GPU. Redid the GPU and VRAM and now it boots up fine again. Quite a pain in the ass to do the VRAM on these I must warn with tight clearance to parts and glue.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
threads.message:
VRAM reflow did the trick, someone replaced the screw mount for the GPU heatsink and directly on the otherside was VRAM so i guess since it still had the glue round it it messed up the balls.

After removing glue and a reflow all is well. Thanks [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER]
